H0.text: Segmentation is influenced by the two unusual hox genes found in arthropods today.

H1.text: Compression is the influence of the two unusual hox genes that arthropods today possess.

H2.text: Reproduction is influenced by the two unusual hox genes that arthropods today possess.

H3.text: Motility is influenced by the two unusual Hox genes that arthropods today have.

A4.text: Hox genes in insects specify which appendages form on a segment (for example, legs, antennae, and wings in fruit flies)
